metadata.title: CVE-2018-14734 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c in the Linux kernel through 4.17.11 allowsucma_leave_multicast to access a certain data structure after a cleanupstep in ucma_process_join, which allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice (use-after-free).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-43-generic - 4.15.0-43.46
linux-image-4.15.0-43-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-43.46
linux-image-4.15.0-43-lowlatency - 4.15.0-43.46
linux-image-4.15.0-43-snapdragon - 4.15.0-43.46
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-43-generic - 4.15.0-43.46
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-43-lowlatency - 4.15.0-43.46
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1030.32
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1031-aws - 4.15.0-1031.33
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-snapdragon - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1036-azure - 4.15.0-1036.38
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1026-gcp - 4.15.0-1026.27
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1028-kvm - 4.15.0-1028.28
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-oem - 4.15.0-1030.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-43.46').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.32').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1031.33').
linux-hwe package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1036.38').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1026.27').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1028.28').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.35').
linux-oracle package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9').
